 class Command
          Command is an event generator that generates application-level events.
 

Methods in ej.microui that return EventGenerator
static EventGenerator[] EventGenerator.get(java.lang.Class clazz)
          Gets all generators whose class is clazz from the system pool.
static EventGenerator EventGenerator.get(java.lang.Class clazz, int fromIndex)
          Gets a generator whose class is clazz from the system pool starting the search from fromIndex.
static EventGenerator EventGenerator.get(int id)
          Gets a generator from its id
static EventGenerator Event.getGenerator(int event)
          Gets a converter out of an event assuming the event has been generated by an EventGenerator that has been previously added to the system pool.
 

Methods in ej.microui with parameters of type EventGenerator
static int Event.buildEvent(int type, EventGenerator gen, int data)
          Builds an event from a given type, an eventGenerator and data.
 

Uses of EventGenerator in ej.microui.io
 

Subclasses of EventGenerator in ej.microui.io
 class Buttons
          A Buttons event generator is usually associated to a group of physical buttons and allow to generate events relating to them.

For a specified subset of buttons it holds the elapsed time since the last event occurrence for that button and supports the optional generation of click and double click events.
 class Keyboard
          A Keyboard event generator allows key combinations to generate a key code.
 class Keypad
          Keypad is a Keyboard that defines an event generator for 12-key keypads.
 class Pointer
          A Pointer event generator represents a pointing device that is usually associated to a group of physical buttons.
 class PointerButtons
          Deprecated.  
 class States
          A States event generator is usually associated to a group of physical devices holding a position (switch, rotary wheel encoder, ...) and allow to generate events relating to them.
